title: 105_hr4558
content:
The Act titled "Noncitizen Benefit Clarification and Other Technical Amendments Act of 1998" clarifies eligibility for SSI and related benefits for nonqualified aliens who were receiving benefits before August 22, 1996, under certain programs. SEC. 3. Extension of authorization of self-employment assistance programs. Repeals paragraph (2) of section 507(e) of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. Amends subsection (e) of section 507 by updating the heading and text placement. 

SEC. 4. Corrections to the Child Support Performance and Incentive Act of 1998. The amendment reduces penalties for states failing to meet child support data processing requirements if certain aspects of the program meet performance thresholds. The amendment modifies effective dates for child support provisions in the Child Support Performance and Incentive Act of 1998. The amendment made by this subsection will be effective as if it was part of the original enactment of the Child Support Performance and Incentive Act of 1998. Nonresident aliens may be eligible to renew professional licenses. Nonresident aliens can renew professional licenses under federal and state or local regulations. Nonresident aliens can renew professional licenses under federal and state or local regulations, including the issuance or renewal of licenses for foreign nationals not physically present in the United States. SEC. 6. Amends the Social Security Act regarding welfare-to-work funds distribution. The amendment is retroactive to 1997. SEC. 7. Addresses disregarding limited awards for children with life-threatening conditions under the Supplemental Security Income Program. The Social Security Act is amended to include a provision for disregarding gifts to individuals under 18 with life-threatening conditions from qualifying organizations, up to $2,000 per calendar year. The Social Security Act is amended to allow for disregarding gifts to individuals under 18 with life-threatening conditions from qualifying organizations, up to $2,000 per calendar year. The amendments to the Social Security Act allow for excluding gifts up to $2,000 per calendar year from qualifying organizations for individuals under 18 with life-threatening conditions. The amendments apply retroactively to gifts made two years before the enactment of the Act. SEC. 8. Enhanced recovery of SSI overpayments from Social Security benefits. Amend Part A of title XI of the Social Security Act to include recovery of SSI overpayments from Social Security benefits. The Commissioner of Social Security can recover overpayments made under the supplemental security income program by reducing future payments under title II of the Act by up to 10 percent. This recovery limitation does not apply if the person or their spouse was involved in fraudulent activity. The Commissioner of Social Security can recover overpayments by reducing future payments under title II of the Act by up to 10 percent if there was willful misrepresentation or concealment of information. This action does not affect eligibility or benefit amounts under the supplemental security income program. The amendments made by this section allow for the recovery of overpayments of supplemental security income benefits by adjusting or withholding future payments under title II of the Act. The effective date of these changes is the date of the enactment of the Act. The amendments allow for the recovery of overpayments of supplemental security income benefits by adjusting or withholding future payments under title II of the Act. This provision takes effect on the date of the enactment of the Act and applies to outstanding amounts incorrectly paid.
